page.title: 11Preservation in Fairford
page.content: Most of our Domesday area is{rural}and only includes the SW of Fairford,which is in a conservation region. Any new buildings must fit in with the old and are made of Cotswold or reconstituted stone.Some of the older buildings can still be seen. On the main road,near the Market Square,stands the{White Hart Inn.}It was formerly a row of cottages and may have housed the church masons.It opened in 1750.Near the Inn is the Hyperion Hotel which used to be the Vicarage.On the corner of the crossroads stands Coln House School, which used to be a private assylum. Northville House opened as a Dames SChool in 1837.It is now a private house.The garage near the town bridge used to be a row of cottages.Burdocks House is the site of the old pest house or isolation hospital.
